Bitcoin‚Äôs long-term security model relies on one assumption:

That BTC‚Äôs price will keep rising enough to outpace falling rewards.
That‚Äôs not a technology bet.
It‚Äôs a faith-based economic one.

@HodlDee Yes one could argue that. LOL

But again, its a retirement account with funds that must stay in tradfi.

My sentiment is the goal is acquiring bitcoin not alt coins or other things. Buying a small position in stocks with money that must stay in tradfi is negligible. 

If I was

Bitcoin is secured by miners.
Miners get paid in two ways:
1) New BTC (block subsidy)
2) Transaction fees

Right now, most of their income comes from new BTC issuance ‚Äî not fees.

Bitcoin has a fundamental security flaw that almost no one talks about.
It could threaten the entire network in the long run.

Meanwhile, Ethereum doesn‚Äôt have this issue. @ethereumJoseph @iamDCinvestor
The fact that we all don‚Äôt own enough Bitcoin is tragic.

@bradymoritz @PeterSchiff While both Bitcoin and Tulip Mania involved speculative price surges driven by hype‚ÄîTulips in 1630s Holland soared then crashed, much like Bitcoin's volatility‚Äîthey differ fundamentally. Tulips were perishable commodities with no utility beyond aesthetics; Bitcoin offers
